page.title: 07CHURCH AND MINISTER
page.content: {The Church}was built in 1240 and with prereformation influence, the Church, all gravestones and inscriptions face East towards the promised land. The individual graveyard has a yew tree and sun-dial. The Church has been extended in the Chancel area where beautiful stained glass windows gifted by the Sprot family stand, and the new entrance has a porch containing another stained glass window dedicated to Dr. McDonald and above which stones from the local dyke or Pictish altar are incorporated into the Church wall. {Interview with Minister}Rev. Peter Douglas has been the Parish Minister for 19 years. There have been 32 ministers since the reformation before which there were Priests. The Church will celebrate 750 years in 4 years. About 20 local people and 20 others attend the Church; the roll is 130.
